lines.gurmukhi: jw kY nwiekw Anyk eyk sy AiDk eyk pUrn suhwg Bwg sauqY sm Dwm hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaa Kai Naaikaa Anayk Ayk Say Adhik Ayka , Pooran Suhaag Bhaag Saoutai Sam Dhaam Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A beloved husband who has many wives and each one better than the other, each one enjoys all the love, attention of husband and other comforts of life.

lines.gurmukhi: mwnn huie mwn BMg ibCur ibdys rhI ibrh ibXog lg ibrhnI Bwm hY
lines.transliteration_english: Maanan Hui Maan Bhang Bichhur Bidays Rahee , Birah Biyog Lag Birahanee Bhaam Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Separated from her dear husband and living far away from him, she feels her respect getting compromised, beside bearing the pangs of separation and thus is called separated.

lines.gurmukhi: isQl smwn qRIXw sky n irJwie piRX dXo hY duhwg vY duhwgn snwm hY
lines.transliteration_english: Sidal Samaan Treeyaa Sakay N Rijhaai Priya , Dayo Hai Duhaag Vai Duhaagan Sanaam Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Like lazy people, idle wife cannot please her husband and as a result she is known as one who has been abandoned by her husband.

lines.gurmukhi: locn s√çn jIh kr AMg AMghIn prsXo n pyKRXo sunRXo myro khw nwm hY ]642]
lines.transliteration_english: Lochan Sravan Jeeh Kar Ang Angaheena , Parasayo N Paykhyo Sounyo Mayro Kahaa Naam Hai ?642?

Shabad OS B.translation: One who enjoys love of her husband is called Suhagan (Happily married). Even separated woman and a Duhagan (unhappy in marriage) also belong to someone and are associated with him, but I have not felt my beloved with any part of my body. I have not seen H
